results.title: Return of the sea elephant
results.creator_credit: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
On the island of Guadalupe, 130 miles off the west coast of Mexico, there is a colony of unique aquatic mammals, the nosed sea elephants. On this trip, Cousteau and the crew of the Calypso examine the habits of these unusual animals and try to gather information as to the size of the herd, whether new colonies are forming and where they go in their seven months at sea. With Jacques Cousteau and narrated by Rod Serling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions

results.title: Return of the Psammead
results.brief_description: When Ellie, Pip, George and Lucy stumble across the Psammead, the Sand Fairy with the amazing ability to grant wishes, they embark on a series of colourful adventures. From naughty twin sisters who appear from nowhere,to glimpses of the future and a grumpy Great Aunt who changes into a mischievous playmate, the four children are whisked into a world of absolute magic where anything is possible. The story by Helen Cresswell is based upon the novels by E. Nesbit.

results.title: Return of the Jedi (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Light sabres hum and sparkle, the Millennium flashes through hyperspace in the blink of an eye, and creatures from the end of the galaxy prepare for battle against the oppressive Imperial Forces in this stunning third chapter of the space saga that has become the most popular trilogy ever filmed. Caption version only available. Rated: PG

results.title: Return of the Jedi
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Howard Kazanjian and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: The conclusion of the “Star Wars” trilogy begins with the rescue of Hans Solo from the evil clutches of Jabba the Hutt. The Galactic Empire has resurrected the Death Star and plans to eliminate the Rebel Alliance once and for all. Luke Skywalker, grappling with the secret that Darth Vader is his father, who was turned evil by the Dark Side of the Force, must confront the Emperor in one final battle. From the seedy den of Jabba the Hutt, to the luscious green peacefulness of the planet Endor with its Ewoks, “The Return of the Jedi” is an entralling action-packed special effects adventure.

results.title: Return of the Jedi
results.creator_credit: Paul Huston, Richard Marquand, James L. Schoppe, Aggie Guerard Rodgers, Fred Hole, Lawrence Kasdan, Norman Reynolds, Nilo Rodis-Jamero, Howard G. Kazanjian, Rick McCallum, George Lucas, 20th Century Fox and Lucasfilm Ltd.
results.brief_description: Luke Skywalker leads a mission to rescue his friend Han Solo from the clutches of Jabba the Hutt, while the Emperor seeks to destroy the Rebellion once and for all with a second dreaded Death Star.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

results.title: Return of Milton Whitty
results.creator_credit: Peter Alford, Don Haldane, Lee Gordon, Construction Safety Assoc of Ontario and Westminster Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”.
A new safety officer in a building construction company meets opposition when he introduces a new safety program. He explains the importance of safety measures. Another in the Milton Whitty Safety series in which he has a new safety problem. A short-sighted foreman who thinks he knows all the answers. He does, except for one. And that is how to prevent accidents. Only when tragedy strikes does he realise that “an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure”.

results.title: Return journey: a tribute to Burke and Wills
results.creator_credit: John Sherman, William Sterling and Albatross Film Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Re-enacts the 1861 expedition of Burke and Wills, with emphasis on the return journey north across the continent of Australia. Relates the rigours and heartbreaks of the expedition, culminating in the deaths of the explorers at Cooper Creek.

results.title: Return journey
results.creator_credit: Ian Potts, Arts Council of Great Britain and Worktown Production
results.brief_description: The film traces the development and usage of the documentary photograph through the work of three photographers, Humphrey Spender, Derek Smith and Jimmy Forsyth. It presents a unique record of English working class life from the 30’s to the 50’s. Narration by Ray Gosling.

results.title: Return home [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, Cristina Pozzan and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Noel, divorced and middle-aged, takes a break from his high pressure job in a big corporation to visit his brother, who, with his wife, is struggling to hang onto a barely viable small business - a service station in Adelaide. Gary, the 19 year old apprentice is struggling to come to terms with the complexities of life as an emerging adult and befriends Noel. Before long, Noel rediscovers the pleasures of family and is revitalised. After his return to Melbourne, his brother Gary and wife Judy, reassess their own lives and begin to see their own potential. Noel eventually returns to Adelaide for good; his journey for happiness, security and a future filled with promise is finally over. Ray Argall’s direction gives form and substance to everyday lives, with a sense of naturalism apparent. Stars Dennis Coard, Frankie J. Holden, Ben Mendelsohn and Micki Camilleri. Cinematography by Mandy Walker. Also available on VHS [305270].
